doc.title: morePhyML

description.text: Improving ML tree searching with PhyML 3

doc.reference: Criscuolo A (2011) morePhyML: improving the phylogenetic tree space exploration with PhyML 3. Molecular Phylogenetics and Evolution.

Guindon S, Dufayard JF, Lefort V, Anisimova M, Hordijk W, Gascuel O (2010) New algorithms and methods to estimate maximum-likelihood phylogenies: assessing the performance of PhyML 3.0. Syst Biol 59:307-321.
Guindon, S. and Gascuel, O. (2003) A simple, fast and accurate algorithm to estimate large phylogenies by maximum likelihood Syst. Biol., 52, 696-704

xhtml:div.label: Nucleotide substitution model (-m) HKY85 JC69 K80 F81 F84 TN93 GTR TN93e TPM1e TPM1u TPM2e TPM2u TPM3e TPM3u TIM1e TIM1u TIM2e TIM2u TIM3e TIM3u TVMe TVMu SYM
Amino-acid substitution model (-m) LG WAG JTT MtREV Dayhoff DCMut RtREV CpREV VT Blosum62 MtMam MtArt HIVw HIVb
Estimated transition/transversion ratio for DNA sequences? (-t) Yes No
User transition/transversion ratio for DNA sequences? (-t)
Estimated proportion of invariable sites? (-v) Yes No
User proportion of invariable sites? (-v)
Number of relative substitution rate categories (-c)
Estimated Gamma distribution parameter? (-a) Yes No
User gamma distribution parameter? (-a)

Equilibrium character frequencies (-f) m: equilibrium frequency estimated by ML for nucleotides or defined by the substitution model for amino acids.
e: equilibrium frequency estimated by counting the occurence of each character state in the alignment.
Most parsimonious starting tree (-p) Yes No
Number of random starting trees to be used (-n)
First tree swapping (-s) SPR NNI both
Branch support (-b) SH-like branch support -2: khi2-based parametric support 0: none support -1: aLRT support
Write the likelihood for each character (-l) Yes No
Write the results outputed by the first run of phyml (-x) Yes No
